title: The more I know about rune changes, the less I'm excited for s8...
body:
I know they're not even here and we might even enjoy it, but c'mon, it's riot... completely changing the rune system will break the game for fucking months. Even when they changed masteries, nothing was balanced for months. And now the whole runes.
And what kind of runes at that, fucking changing summs during game, first AA giving basically the same shit as iceborn gauntlet, etc...
I really hate all those changes and I'm not looking forward to the preseason at all.

replies.body:
Same here, at first I was optimistic and thought it had great potential, but as time goes on I am seeing more and more potentially obnoxious gimmicks that are gonna' be introduced with s8.

But more than that, my issue is how drastically this is going to change the game, and so suddenly. 

Mechanical changes to the game should really be introduced slowly so we have time to adjust, and if something goes horribly wrong there is less issue in reverting it or reworking it into something good... This new runes system is going to be so sweeping across all lanes, all playstyles, all strategies that we use in every period of the game... This is really risky by Riot, in my opinion.

I know that sounds dramatic but honestly the latest reveal of Summoner Specialist is just that, a sweeping mechanical change. And the previously highlighted keystones while less drastic are still capable of changing play patterns pretty heavily.

Hey Avarist - 

Wanted to speak to your points here because I think this is a totally valid reaction that a lot of players are sharing right now. 

We know that this level of change is going to be slightly overwhelming for a lot of players, which is why we're making these changes for Preseason _specifically_ to have time to balance and change things (and for you guys to try things outside of the ranked season). We're also limiting other in game changes coming out at the same time beyond the super necessary stuff for the reasons you describe. We'll do our best to keep you guys as updated as possible on what we're going to do around runes balance, etc. We've had multiple teams focused on playtesting and balancing already, but we know that we can't 100% cover everything internally that the...well..._lots_ of you will experience and discover (big shout out to Playtest team and Live Gameplay for all of their help so far). 

This was one instance where we simply couldn't keep making incremental changes to the runes & masteries systems though. It could only take us so far. We've mentioned before that keystone masteries were an early test for some of the things we want to achieve with these new runes. One of the things this test showed us is that if we ever wanted to follow through on having meaningful pregame decisions (which you guys have been rightly asking for) then it would require some big changes to the _rules_, not just new content.  

We do know that impactful runes like Summoner Specialist are scary (and hopefully exciting for some players?), but we're hyper aware that these are big changes and are committed to monitoring and reacting over Preseason. Some of the runes we've already talked about have already been changed or edited since because everything we're showing is super duper work in progress. I know that actions speak louder than words, so I don't expect you to take my word for it here, but I did want to put all of this out there for you guys.

I think with such big changes, you guys SHOULDN'T start the season early like you did last year.

Starting the season in December will only give you guys less time to moniter & balance stuff. And any leftover balance problems wouldn't be address until the new year after Riot had it's winter break. This will greatly affect players Ranked experiences for that month.

I don't mind all the pregame changes (to a certain degree). I prefer to wait & see the full thing in action before I make a solid opinion on it. But I just hope you guys take time with these massive changes.
I will voice your concerns to the folks who set the dates.

Said it before and ill probably say it again. Personally I like that you guys take risks with your balancing and season changes. Lowers stagnation of this moba more then others that rely just on balance changes, reworks, and new heros. The pregame decisions sold me on league back in season 1. Dota 2 disappointed me when it was just copy and pasted all-stars (its gotten better but just the unwillingness to do away with janky mechanics that only existed due to limitations in Wc3 map editor prevent it from being my go to moba.)

Will you guys screw up? No doubt, but long as yall own mistakes, learn, and keep going ham I feel its worthwhile. Glhf see ya on the rift mate.

I care about 1 simple thing, if there has to be a pre-game loadout system, then I want it to offer ACTUAL decision making. Basically this scenario has to be a far more common thing than it is now: 2 players who main the same champion will have different masteries/runes based on their playstyle, not 100% obvious synergies
It just not possible, after awhile everyone will work out that one thing is amazing on a champ and 70% of the people playing that champ will use it

I have to agree. Although I think it could be made a little more possible. They need more gameplay style runes as opposed to stats, things that are more universal. Like "do X creates a shield for your ally" is potentially more viable in more scenarios than "increases all shielding X %"
They need to be more utility based or require prep time of some sort. Things that enable you to do new mechanical things not more defense or more offense.

They also need to be a little mixed within each tree. Like if you really want 1 keystone but had to pick things along the way which may or not be such obvious choices. Not I'm a carry I'll pick easy choices down the damage tree

I think part of the problem is that there are trees at all. Having tiers is fine but I think they should just do away with having trees so that you can customize far more. When you HAVE to pick nothing but tank, damage, or utility runes then that's just telling people to find the best setup for being tanky or dealing damage or having utility. A grab bag of runes in tiers of power opens up a lot more for finding your own personal style.

A part of the point is to make massive, quite possibly dangerous, changes to the game.

The rune system has needed a total revamp for a LONG time, and with them making runes "free" they decided to just roll them into Masteries and be done with having both sides of the coin to balance.  Now they have just a single more comprehensive system to balance and change (A part of the old rune issue was that changing them was a big no-no because of how much of an investment they were to obtain for players, now Riot can freely add, change, or remove as they see fit based on balance), and this massively drops the new player grind (No more 200k+ IP spent on Runes.  That is worth 31 6300 IP champs), which has gotten massively bloated compared to days of old just thanks to the fact that the champion pool has doubled (With mostly 6300 champions to boot) making it hard to get access to a lot of the content.


This is a dangerous change for Riot in multiple ways, that exclusively serves to the player benefit long term.  I wouldn't be surprised if this is why Riot has been releasing more expensive skins lately, knowing that champ money income is going to drop even further for them to near nothing.
Riot is a billion dollar company... nobody but noobs actually buy champs. The near entirety of their revenue comes from Skins and LC$
